Quick intro into stablecoins

Before diving into our new listings, let's understand what stablecoins are. Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies designed to minimize the volatility typically associated with digital currencies like Bitcoin or Ethereum. They achieve this stability by being pegged to a stable asset, such as fiat currencies like the USD, JPY, or EUR.

They aim to reduce risk in your crypto portfolio, as well as simplify global money transfers, and bypass traditional banking hurdles.

More about GYEN

GYEN is the world’s first regulated Japanese Yen stablecoin and is issued by the reputable GMO-Z.com Trust Company. Every GYEN issued has a 1:1 reserve balance and combined with its regulation by the New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS), makes it an appealing choice for those looking to diversify their portfolio. Learn more about GYEN.

Get to know ZUSD

Also issued by GMO-Z.com Trust Company, ZUSD is pegged to the US Dollar, providing a trusted digital equivalent that combines the familiarity and reliability of the USD with the flexibility of a cryptocurrency. This makes ZUSD a cornerstone asset for both traders and businesses looking for a stablecoin with a strong regulatory profile. Read our article on ZUSD.
